Manasseh, one of the Twelve Tribes

Manasseh or Menashe ×Ö°× Ö·×©Ö¶Ö¼××” was, according to the Book of Genesis, the first son of Joseph and Asenath.

Manasseh was born in Egypt before the arrival of the children of Israel from Canaan (Genesis 48:5). Asenath (ğ“…­ğ“ ğ“Œ¢ğ“?) was an Egyptian woman whom the Pharaoh gave to Joseph as wife, and the daughter of Potipherah (ğ€¡ğ€´â€¦), a priest of On ğ“‰ºğ“Œğ“Š– (Genesis 41:50â€“52).
